Even better, we found that that TaDah Foods is now sold in retailers across America like Target, Publix, Whole Foods, Kroger, Wegmans, and more.

They are also available through the TaDah Foods website.

BrandYourself.recapBody:
Shark Tank Brand Yourself Update

We have good news to share in our Brand Yourself update! Despite failing to secure a deal on Shark Tank Season 6, the company is estimated to generate more than $5 million in gross sales every single year and continues to hire new employees to help maintain the platform and business. Services are available on the Brand Yourself website.

ISlide Customizable Sandals.recapBody:
Shark Tank ISlide Update

After airing on Shark Tank, ISlide quickly scored licensing deals with big names like DC Comics, the NBA, MLB, and Nickelodeon, pushing the company's valuation to $10 million by 2019.

However, like many businesses, our ISlide update found that the company faced serious challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic.

The disruption to supply chains and the cancellation of sports events took a heavy toll on sales.

Despite these setbacks, ISlide made a strong comeback by mid-2021, regaining its footing with $9 million in annual revenue.

Our ISlide update found that by 2023, the company was back to $10 million in sales, driven by creative new designs like gel and fur soles and an expanded product line that now includes robes, socks, and hats.

Founder Justin Kittredge remains actively involved in steering the brand, with a strong focus on social media engagement.

At the time of writing, ISlide has partnered with Perfect Game to create custom slides for youth sports, continuing to grow and innovate in the market.

We're calling this a success and can't wait to bring you our next ISlide update.

Plufl Dog Bed For Humans.recapBody:
Shark Tank Plufl Update

Our Plufl update found that the deal with Mark Cuban and Lori Greiner did not close, but the business maintained strong momentum.

Due to their Shark Tank exposure, they sold over 3,000 units. To meet high demand, they operated on a pre-order basis for January 2023.

They also moved operations to a fulfillment facility in Shepherdsville, Kentucky.

By August 2023, Plufl shifted from pre-orders to immediate shipping. U.S. customers now receive their products within 3–7 business days.

They reduced the price to $350, making the product more accessible, and ended 2022 with $1 million in sales.

The company expanded its offerings with two new products: the Hugl, a cooling pillow, and a cooling fitted sheet for the Plufl.

In 2023, they received the prestigious House Beautiful Live Better Award, further solidifying their brand reputation.

At the time of this writing, our Plufl update found that the company has sold over 12,000 units and achieved a $1.5 million net worth.

Plufl now generates $280,000 in annual revenue, contributing to approximately $4 million in lifetime sales.

It's safe to call this Plufl update a success.

Angellift Reduces Facial Wrinkles.recapBody:
Shark Tank AngelLift Update

Let’s get straight to the AngelLift update! This was an investment that never materialized, as Aaron refused to appear on QVC when the cameras stopped rolling. Despite this, the company has an estimated annual revenue of around $4 million. If you're interested in giving their products a try, you can get them on the AngelLift website.

Ecomower.recapBody:
Shark Tank Ecomowers Update

Our Ecomowers update shows that the company did not make it long after Andy’s appearance on Shark Tank. There is no longer a website, nor any active social media. Andy seems to have moved on to other business ventures.

This will be our final Ecomowers update.

Bibbitec.recapBody:
Shark Tank Bibbitec Update

They felt Bibbitec required educating the customer prior to purchase. Robert asked if the couple had considered licensing the idea to a bib manufacturer with distribution channels. This would help get it to market much faster and at a much larger scale. Susie said that she could not pursue that route “morally” because of the toxins used in Chinese factories overseas.

When Susie said she wanted to prove that America could produce great quality products domestically, Kevin went on the offensive again. He said that America can make great products, but they can’t afford Bibbitec because the price was outrageous.

Steve tried to build excitement talking about the response Bibbitec received at tradeshows, but the sharks remained unconvinced. Daymond John tried tossing a lifeline to this failing pitch, asking if the Taylors truly believed they could get the cost down. The Taylors said that, with a large enough order, they should get the cost lower.

By now, Susie was losing her cool and began acting defensively to the sharks' criticism. Robert addressed the talk of lowering costs and said it was a good plan, but he didn’t understand the Taylors’ plan to sell thousands of Bibbitec bibs to the mass market.

Mark Cuban said he liked the bib and was not deterred by the price point but he personally found the Taylors very much unequipped to run the business. He advised they find a college kid to launch an Internet marketing campaign on the cheap and get the word out. Mark said there were solutions out there to their problems, but the solution was not him, so he was out.

Barbara Corcoran spoke next, stating that Mark’s advice was very good. She also told the Taylors that there was likely an equally passionate salesforce available– other moms. With that, she was out. Kevin was not at all interested in investing, so he too went out.

Daymond John went out next, as he felt he could offer no value to the Taylors. Robert went out last, telling the Taylors that their pitch included a number of confusing strategies, and that he personally felt they had no clear plan for success. With that, they were forced to leave without a deal. What happened next? Keep reading our Bibbitec update to find out!

As with many pitches, exposure from the show led to a spike in sales, and they sold nearly $40,000 in one weekend! Despite this, after some time sales became stagnant to the point where the product was no longer available. In 2019, the business closed down, so this will be our final Bibbitec update.

Cropsticks Bamboo Chopsticks With Built-.recapBody:
Shark Tank CropSticks Update

Our CropSticks update found that the company secured a patent in April 2018 for its innovative bamboo chopstick design.

Additionally, CropSticks formed partnerships with major clients, including Disney properties, The Four Seasons, and Roy's restaurants.

To meet the rising demand for sustainable dining solutions, the company also launched bamboo fiber straws and reusable chopsticks, diversifying its product line.

Moreover, in 2019, CropSticks achieved Certified B Corporation status, marking its commitment to social and environmental responsibility.

This certification, along with the company's eco-friendly focus, helped CropSticks gain traction in retail.

Its products are now available in over 500 locations, including Walgreens and Cost Plus World Market.

At the time of writing, our CropSticks update research found that the company generates approximately $1.2 million in annual revenue and has grown to an estimated net worth of $1.5 million.

If we get another CropSticks update, we will let you know.

Wad-free Bed Sheet Laundry Detangler.recapBody:
Shark Tank Wad-Free Update

Before appearing on Shark Tank, Wad-Free was already for sale in Walmart, Amazon, The Grommet, and through the Wad-Free website. With almost instant popularity, Wad-Free earned features on Today, Apartment Therapy, BuzzFeed, Bustle, The Spruce, Southern Living, and even Reader’s Digest!

In our Wad-Free update, we found that sales have increased a ton since the episode aired due to the Shark Tank effect. Kevin publicly sings the praises of his partnership with Wad-Free, which has an estimated $5 million net worth as of 2023.

We got a chance to interview Cyndi to see how Wad-Free's been doing since Shark Tank. "Wad-Free has grown considerably since airing on Shark Tank," Cyndi told us.

Cyndi shared that since airing, she released a new heavy-duty version of the product designed for blankets and duvet covers, which her customers love.

Even better, she has gone viral on TikTok multiple times. "Livestream product demonstrations are fantastic for showing Wad-Free in action," Cyndi told us.

She also confirmed that the deal with Kevin did end up going through and that working with him has been a great experience. "Working with Kevin and Team Wonderful has been&well&wonderful! They are supportive, resourceful, and great human beings, said Cyndi.

We'd like to thank Cyndi for taking the time to speak to us and giving us an official Wad-Free update!

Controlled Chaos Hair Care for Curly Hai.recapBody:
Shark Tank Controlled Chaos Update

Our Controlled Chaos update revealed that the deal with Lori never closed. However, it’s still great news for the company.

Following the episode, the company sold more units than ever before. They’ve now hired additional employees and purchased an independent distribution facility. Controlled Chaos has about $3.5 million in annual revenue.

You can find Controlled Chaos hair products on Amazon as well as on its website.

I Want to Draw a Cat for You.recapBody:
Shark Tank I Want to Draw a Cat for You Update

Our I Want to Draw a Cat for You update reveals that the company finally enjoyed great success after appearing on Shark Tank. Steve finally got to pay Mark back, and did so many cat drawings that he basically started experiencing cramps.

After a while, he took a break from cat drawings to focus on his TV show, but has since returned to the original business. You can check out the drawings and purchase your own on the I Want to Draw a Cat for You website.

Evidently, his service is so popular, that he is actually booked out a year in advance. He now charges $25 per drawing.

SlumberPod Privacy Tent for Toddlers.recapBody:
Shark Tank SlumberPod Update

Our Slumberpod following Shark Tank update has some good news to share! In 2020, SlumberPod won the Good Design Award in the Children’s category.

Also, it turns out that word-of-mouth advertising between moms really is effective! That's because the company is now enjoying an estimated yearly revenue of $10 million, which is incredibly impressive!

Further, since partnering with the eCommerce technology company, Artica, sales have increased by at least 15.7%. But that's not all; the company has also expanded its product line to include SlumberPod Pets, to help pets sleep well in their crates.

Check out their products at Walmart, Target, Amazon, and on the SlumberPod website.

ShowNo Towel.recapBody:
Shark Tank Show No Update

Our Show No update reveals that after some initial success, the business undoubtedly experienced a bumpy road. Shelly also revealed that the partnership with Lori never materialized.

She finally closed the business for good in 2017, after several failed attempts at mass manufacturing.

The good news is that Shelly moved on to something she is equally passionate about. She's now a clinical hynotherapist. However, this will be our final Show No company update.

Booty Queen Apparel.recapBody:
Shark Tank BootyQueen Apparel Update

Our BootyQueen Apparel update found that the deal with Daymond John successfully closed. John expressed confidence in Amanda's influence and the brand's potential.

Following their Shark Tank appearance, the business gained significant media attention.

In 2017, Amanda promoted the brand by making a cameo on Lifetime's reality show Little Women: Dallas.

Later, in 2018, the apparel was featured in a segment on "The Dr. Oz Show."

Furthering their expansion, in January 2019, the Kuclo opened a retail store in Plano, Texas, marking a significant step in their expansion efforts.

By November 2021, BootyQueen Apparel reported an annual revenue of approximately $3 million.

Despite these earlier successes, the company faced challenges.

Eventually, by mid-2021, BootyQueen Apparel ceased updating its social media accounts, and its website became inactive.

As of August 2023, the brand's products were unavailable online, indicating a halt in operations.

Our research on the BootyQueen Apparel update found that Amanda and Steve Kuclo divorced in 2022.

Amanda reverted to her maiden name, Amanda Latona, and shifted her focus to other ventures, including her role as an athlete with ALLMAX Nutrition.

Meanwhile, Steve Kuclo remarried and continued his career in bodybuilding and fitness training.

At the time of this writing, BootyQueen Apparel appears to be inactive, with no recent updates or product availability.

It appears this is our final BootyQueen Apparel update.

Sunscreen Mist Sunblock Spray Booth.recapBody:
Shark Tank Sunscreen Mist Update

We have good news to report in our Sunscreen Mist update! It turns out that the company has redeveloped their machines and can be found in nearly 2 dozen locations around North America. They bring in an estimated $1-2 million in yearly gross revenue. You can find out more about their products on the Sunscreen Mist website.

Nomiku Sous Vide Cooker.recapBody:
Shark Tank Nomiku Update

Our Nomiku update found that the deal with Chris Sacca eventually closed.

Furthermore, shortly after its episode aired, the product caught the attention of not only home cooks but also top chefs, including those from famous restaurants like Noma.

Riding on this wave of success, Nomiku expanded its product line in 2016, introducing a Wi-Fi-enabled sous vide machine for $249, compared to the original $199 model.

This new version allowed users to control the device remotely. Lisa also released two sous vide cookbooks and launched a meal delivery service.

However, despite the initial excitement, Nomiku ran into some challenges. The Wi-Fi version, though innovative, received mixed reviews.

In 2016, CNET criticized the device for being bulky and outdated, offering little more than a remote control.

Meanwhile, competitors flooded the market with cheaper, more feature-rich alternatives, making it harder for Nomiku to stand out.

Our Nomiku update found that the company launched a third version with RFID technology that could automatically set temperatures, but it didn't stay on the market long.

In addition to these struggles, Nomiku faced significant delays in fulfilling Kickstarter orders. Many customers received faulty products, while others never received their machines at all.

Even with lifetime sales of $8 million, Nomiku couldn't overcome its manufacturing issues and stiff competition.

Our Nomiku update research found that the company eventually succumbed to its numerous struggles and went out of business in December 2019 after failing to secure more venture capital.

At the time of writing, the founders have moved on to other ventures.

Lisa shifted to a new career in psychedelic integration and counseling, while Abe transitioned into A.I. engineering, working with Sourceress and Imbue.

Unfortunately, this will be our final Nomiku update.

PrideBites.recapBody:
Shark Tank PrideBites Update

While the deal with Lori and Robert never closed, our PrideBites update shows that Shark Tank was highly beneficial to the company. After appearing on the show, PrideBites received $500,000 in seed money from other investors involved with the company.

PrideBites has since been experiencing steady growth. You can purchase PrideBites on the official website.

Solemates High Heel Protector Cap.recapBody:
Shark Tank Solemates Update

Our Solemates update found that the deal with Robert Herjavec ultimately fell through as the entrepreneurs preferred to keep control of their business.

By 2018, Solemates had secured a game-changing partnership with CVS, which pushed their annual revenue to $1.8 million.

In addition, their product catalog has grown beyond heel protectors.

Now, they offer everything from blister balms to weather protection sprays, and endorsements from stars like Oprah Winfrey and Demi Lovato boost their visibility.

Furthermore, our research on the Solemates update found that its products are available in over 4,000 stores, on Amazon, and on its website.

At the time of writing, their business has grown to around $2 million in annual revenue.

We’re calling this Solemates update a success!

The Bobble Place Bobbleheads.recapBody:
Shark Tank The Bobble Place Update

Our research on The Bobble Place update found that the company successfully pivoted by shelving plans for physical kiosks and focusing on online sales through the HD Design Centers website.

This shift allowed Jeff to retain full control of his company and grow it on his own terms.

At the time of this writing, The Bobble Place is now known as WeBobble. Additionally, their website offers hundreds of customizable bobblehead bodies and ready-made options.

The company operates a factory employing skilled artisans for sculpting and finishing, mold makers, and packaging specialists who create custom boxes for each bobblehead.

Our The Bobble Place update found that the company has experienced significant growth and has grown to over $5 million in annual revenue.

We're calling this The Bobble Place update a success.

Nardo's Natural Organic Skin Care.recapBody:
Shark Tank Nardo’s Natural Update

Our Nardo’s Natural update reveals that the deal with Barbara eventually came to fruition, and also proved to be very successful. While the brothers didn’t end up changing the name, the company has enjoyed great sales since appearing on Shark Tank.

Further, the range of products has expanded to include a full line of all things bath and beauty. The line also has a new look.

Additionally, Nardo's Natural is now bringing in an estimated $5 million in annual revenue.

Check out the products on the Nardo’s Natural website, or on Amazon.

MountainFlow Eco-Wax Plant Based Ski Wax.recapBody:
Shark Tank MountainFlow Update

In terms of a MountainFlow update, we're happy to share that the company is still in business! We're even happier to report that they have an estimated net worth of $3 million!

Since their time on Shark Tank Season 12, they've expanded their product line to include bike lubricant, recycled aluminum skis, apparel, and more. They've even sponsored their own ski team!

Be sure to check out all their gear on Amazon, and the MountainFlow Eco-wax website!

Saucemoto Dip Clip Car Sauce Holder.recapBody:
Shark Tank Saucemoto Update

In our Sauncemoto update research, we found that Kevin never finalized the deal after the Shark Tank appearance. The company is still in operation and can be found online. It is estimated that the company continues to generate about $400,000 in sales per year. Not bad for a sauce holder!

Firefighter Turnout Bags.recapBody:
Shark Tank Firefighter Turnout Bags Update

Our Firefighter Turnout Bags update found that the deal with Lori Greiner never closed, but the company saw a spike in popularity shortly after its episode aired.

Moreover, Nicole even launched the “Probie” line, which included phone cases, wallets, and backpacks made from both recycled and new materials.

However, as demand grew, so did the pressures of running the business. Nicole found herself stretched thin, balancing the demands of scaling up and her personal life.

Unfortunately, by early 2021, Nicole made the difficult decision to close the business.

Our research on the Firefighter Turnout Bags update found that over its 13 years, the business had recycled close to 50,000 pieces of firefighter gear.

These products are crafted to honor the spirit of first responders.

At the time of writing, the company had fully closed its doors, with the website offline and products no longer available.

It appears this will be our final Firefighter Turnout Bags update.

Shark Tank Pipsnacks Update

It’s been mostly smooth sailing since appearing on Shark Tank. Research for our Pipsnacks update revealed that Pipsnacks has evolved into Pipcorn Snacks, which seems to be a more fitting name. Barbara managed to help Jeff and Jennifer grow their business to generate millions of dollars in annual revenue. You can shop their products on the Pipsnacks website and on Amazon.

SpiritHoods.recapBody:
Shark Tank SpiritHoods Update

We have good news to report for our SpiritHoods update! Despite not getting a deal from the sharks, the company has maintained success in the many years since the founders’ appearance on the show.

Their revenue is now estimated to be $5 million annually. Products can be found on the SpiritHoods website and on Amazon.

Cinnaholic Cinnamon Roll Dessert Shop.recapBody:
Shark Tank Cinnaholic Update

RocketBook Reusable Notebook.recapBody:
Shark Tank Rocketbook Update

Our Rocketbook update revealed that the company expanded its product line to online giants like Amazon and prominent retail chains such as Best Buy, Office Depot, Staples, and Target.

Further, by December 2018, the company had sold over 500,000 notebooks and generated more than $10 million in revenue.

In 2020, the company reported net sales of $32 million, reflecting a remarkable 35% year-over-year increase.

In December of that year, BIC bought Rocketbook for $40 million.

The goal was to combine BIC's experience in making writing tools with Rocketbook's digital notebook technology.

Following the acquisition, co-founders Joe Lemay and Jake Epstein remained at the helm, focusing on product development and further expanding the brand's market presence.

Our research into the Rocketbook update found that the company now operates as a subsidiary of BIC.

Despite not getting a deal on Shark Tank, we are calling this Rocketbook update a success.

Enso Silicone Wedding Bands.recapBody:
Shark Tank Enso Rings Update

Despite reaching a preliminary agreement with Robert Herjavec, the investment deal ultimately fell through. However, the exposure from Shark Tank proved to be a major boost for Enso Rings.

In the weeks following the episode's airing, they saw a surge in sales, generating an additional $2 million and processing 500 orders daily.

By spring 2019, they had reached a major milestone: surpassing 2 million rings sold. Their customer base has expanded globally to over 80 countries.

To cater to diverse preferences, they introduced new product lines, including a birthstone collection and limited-edition rings released periodically.

Despite their growth, they maintained a commitment to quality control, with every ring being handcrafted at their Lehi, Utah facility.

In August 2020, they achieved a remarkable accomplishment by ranking 316th on the Inc. 5000 list. Even more impressive, Enso Rings achieved this ranking with a staggering three-year revenue growth of 1,442.73%.

In 2021, our Enso Rings update found that they launched new lines featuring popular franchises like Disney Princess and Star Wars, catering to a wider audience. Their product diversification extended beyond rings, as they also introduced bracelets to their collection.

In September 2022, they further expanded their product line with a Harry Potter collection featuring both rings and bracelets to cater to fans of the popular franchise.

Additionally, they secured a major partnership with Zales Jewelers, making their rings available for purchase on their website and in stores nationwide.

Enso Rings maintains its impressive performance, with a consistent annual revenue of $16 million.

Brighton and Aaron's progress looks impressive, and we can't wait to share the latest in our next Enso rings update.

Rekkie AR Ski Googles.recapBody:
Shark Tank Rekkie Update

Our Rekkie update reveals that the company has been doing well since appearing on Shark Tank. We're sure that with the help of Mark, the Peace brothers will successfully continue to grow their company and brand.

The goggles have been featured by top cold-weather sports publications, and customers seem to be really happy with their purchases.

After the dust settles, we will circle back around for another Rekkie update.

Shark Tank AIRA Update

Our research for the AIRA update revealed incredible news. It turns out, that AIRA is doing quite well for itself. The company has since rebranded to FreePower and has an estimated yearly revenue of $8 million.

Since the show, they’ve secured a partnership with Nomad, who now makes the Nomad Base Station using AIRA's tech. FastCompany also featured the company, alongside AMD, Samsung, and Apple, in their list of 2021’s most innovative companies.

Additionally, our AIRA update research found that it is also taking the automotive world by storm. Motherson, one of the leading companies for auto parts supply, has partnered with AIRA and plans to put their FreePower technology into newly produced cars.

Since then, they've also partnered with Tesla, licensing a wireless charger from the company. Further, Jake was named as a Forbes 30 Under 30 recipient.

Potato Parcel.recapBody:
Shark Tank Potato Parcel Update

Our Potato Parcel update found that the deal with Kevin O'Leary successfully closed.

Shortly after airing, the company made headlines in early 2017 when NBA star Dirk Nowitzki received anonymous potatoes congratulating him on his 30,000 career points.

By 2018, the company had expanded beyond its original concept, introducing fun new products like birthday bundles, glitter bombs, and "big head" cutouts.

According to our Potato Parcel update research, this growth translated into over $700,000 in revenue, and Riad reportedly earned a six-figure salary.

Additionally, The Shark Tank Greatest of All Time Special highlighted Potato Parcel in February 2020.

At the time of writing, Potato Parcel is still going strong, with annual revenues between $600,000 and $700,000.

If you’d like to send someone a potato, you can do so through the official website.

We are happy to report a successful Potato Parcel update.

Bug Bite Thing Suction Tool.recapBody:
Shark Tank Bug Bite Thing Update

Research for our Bug Bite Thing update revealed fantastic news. In 2023, the company announced that it has done $21 million in sales since Shark Tank and is now in over 25,000 retail store locations.

Bug Bite Thing is in most major retailers, including Target, CVS, Amazon, and a host of other big-box retailers. We're betting Lori's retail connections helped make that possible.

Our Bug Bite Things update research also found that in June 2023 they acquired TickEase, which are patented fine-tipped tweezers that are made to remove ticks from people and pets.

The Dough Bar Donuts.recapBody:
Shark Tank The Dough Bar Update

Our research on The Dough Bar update revealed that the deal with Barbara successfully closed.

Since then, The Dough Bar's sales have surged, reaching nearly $2 million within just nine months.

With Barbara Corcoran's guidance, the entrepreneurs opened The Doughnut Club Bakery in Fort Collins, Colorado, in April 2019.

However, by October, our The Dough Bar found that they filed for bankruptcy and closed the location due to debt from their move to Colorado.

The Doughnut Club reopened in June 2020, expanding its menu to include protein-packed items like cinnamon rolls and monkey bread.

The business grew, operating four locations by 2021. Unfortunately, the pandemic forced these stores to close.

In May 2022, the couple stepped away from the business to care for their newborn daughter, who suffered serious health issues. They halted operations but hinted at a future return.

Further, at the time of writing, their domain is still active, suggesting a potential comeback.

Hopefully, this won't be our final The Dough Bar update.

Baker's Edge.recapBody:
Shark Tank Baker’s Edge Update

We have good news to share in our Baker's Edge update! If you’re an avid baker or cook, you’ll probably be glad to know it is still in business. The company went on to be acquired for an undisclosed amount by Sorfeo in 2022. Their expanded line of products is available on Amazon, and on the Baker's Edge website.

Partie Poche Cell Phone Leg Strap.recapBody:
Shark Tank Partie Poche Update

Unfortunately, Conner and Jillian were unable to get their brand off the ground, and eventually sold Partie Poche to a company called Audacis. Within a year of that sale, Audacis went out of business. As for Connor and Jillian, things worked out anyway. Connor, as of 2022, works as a Wealth Advisor at JAG Capital Management, while Jillian became the CEO of Pier Asset Management. This will be our final Partie Poche update.

Forus Athletic Shoes.recapBody:
Shark Tank Forus Athletics Update

We have sad news to report in our Forus Athletics update. Sadly, the company didn’t last long after appearing on Shark Tank.  By the end of 2015, Forus Athletics no longer existed and both entrepreneurs had moved onto new projects. This will be our final Forus Athletics update.

Fur Oil.recapBody:
Shark Tank Fur Update

Research for our Fur update found that the company. Although they've managed to boost their yearly revenue to $5 million.

Additionally, the Fur website seems to be going strong, and the company has greatly expanded their product line. The company has also been featured in publications like Vogue and Refinery29.

Plus, the celebrity endorsement they mentioned on the show (Emma Watson) is still a major selling point as well. In addition to Amazon, Fur is also in stores like Urban Outfitters, Goop, and Neiman Marcus.

Drive Suits Motorized Costumes.recapBody:
Shark Tank Drive Suits Update

We have good news to share in our Drive Suits update. While the deal with Kevin never closed,  Drew and Drive Suits would go on to appear on numerous TV shows, before rebranding to Robots and Cars Entertainment, Inc., or R.A.C.E. In 2023, the costumes are still around but not available for purchase. Instead, R.A.C.E. is available for hire and they appear at commercial events. Details of their annual revenue is unclear, but they are still in business.

Tippi Toes.recapBody:
Shark Tank Tippi Toes Update

Our Tippi Toes update reveals that the company is still a success years later and has grown from seven franchises to 36. Further, we found that the deal with Mark Cuban never closed.

In 2023, they have 36 franchises and they also offer virtual classes, which likely came about during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Each of the Tippi Toes franchise stores offers dance classes, camps, and parties. Their CDs are available online for download or as physical CDs,  on the Tippi Toes website.

Traditional Fisheries Lionfish.recapBody:
Shark Tank Traditional Fisheries Update

Unfortunately, within months of filming, the company went out of business. Dave and Gary moved onto other ventures, but their mission would live on. As of 2021, Publix and Whole Foods have started selling lionfish filets. This will be our final Traditional Fisheries update.

BedJet Heating and Cooling for Beds.recapBody:
Shark Tank Bed Jet Update

We have great news to report! Research for our Bed Jet update revealed that despite not making a deal on Shark Tank, the company seems to be growing and thriving. With more than 100,000 units sold on Amazon, it seems like Bed Jet is on an excellent trajectory to remain successful for a very long time. Besides Amazon, products are available on the Bed Jet website.

Safety Nailer.recapBody:
Shark Tank Safety Nailer Update

We have good news to share in our Safety Nailer update. After airing on Shark Tank, the company is doing around $2 million in annual sales, and they've even expanded their product line to include several other handy items.

Further, the company started a Kickstarter to fund the clacker toy and raised almost $9,000. It's available on the Safety Nailer website in addition to the Safety Nailer, and all of the other products they produce.

We also found an interview with The Virginian-Pilot, where Drew revealed that the deal with the three sharks didn't end up going through.

Despite this, the company still seems to be doing well. You can find the Safety Nailer online and at Ace Hardware.

If we get more news on a Safety Nailer update, we will let you know!

The Cookie Dough Cafe.recapBody:
Shark Tank The Cookie Dough Café Update

We have great news to share in The Cookie Dough Café update! The company is still in business in 2023, with an estimated annual revenue of around $5 million. The brand is sold across the country, carried by many different grocery chains and convenience stores. It can also be ordered directly from The Cookie Dough Café website, and on Amazon.

Bad Birdie Golf Shirts.recapBody:
Shark Tank Bad Birdie Update

We have good news to share in our Bad Birdie update. Like most small businesses, this company faced some inventory issues during the COVID-19 pandemic.

However, they were able to recover and reports estimate that their yearly revenue is between $6-$7 million, which is a long way from where they started!

Additionally, the Bad Birdie website is still going strong, with large collections of colorful prints for sale.

We also learned that the company now has a high school sponsorship program, where you can apply to have your golf team dressed by Bad Birdie.

If we get any more news on a Bad Birdie update, we will let you know!

Bubbly Blaster Champagne Sprayer Gun.recapBody:
Shark Tank Bubbly Blaster Update

The Bubbly Blaster is simply an attachment that you can add to a bottle of champagne that makes it shoot out like a water gun, allowing the party to last longer.

Stanson and Brad told the sharks that they believe their product could be used for every future NBA, MLB, NHL, and NFL championship celebration.

To make things even better, it only costs $18 for Stanson and Brad to manufacture a blaster, while it sells for $100. Further, when Bubbly Blaster appeared on Shark Tank, it had amassed $560,000 in sales in just over a year.

All of this was enough to interest Mark Cuban, who offered $120,000 for 25% equity. However, Alex Rodriguez was also interested so they decided to join forces.

This was the obvious option for Stanson and Brad, as Mark owns the NBA's Dallas Mavericks and Alex is a former MLB legend.

Together, Mark and Alex closed a deal with Bubbly Blaster for $180,000 for 30% equity.

So, did Stanson and Brad end up celebrating championships together for years to come? Let's get a Bubbly Blaster update to find out what happened after Shark Tank.

We have mixed news to share in our Bubbly Blaster update. It's unclear if Stanson and Brad were able to close the deal with Mark and Alex. However, the company still has an estimated annual revenue of $700,000.

While things have been a bit quiet since appearing on Shark Tank, it seems that Stanson and Brad have expanded their product line to include a phone accessory and branded hats. It's unclear how much the business has grown since Shark Tank, but it does seem that they are still around.

You can check out all they offer on the Bubbly Blaster website.

We have reached out to Stanson to get a more official Bubbly Blaster update, we'll be sure to let you know if we hear back!

Remyxx Recyclable Sneakers (ReKixx).recapBody:
Shark Tank Remyxx ReKixx Update

Our Remyxx ReKixx Sneakers update shows that the deal with Daymond never happened, but he did advise Gary. It turns out, that Daymond didn't want Gary to have to give up so much of the company afterall.

With Daymond's advice, Gary raised money through Kickstarter. Because of that, the business continued for awhile, and he enjoyed $40,000 in sales. However, he ultimately had to close it down in 2019. This will be our final Remyxx ReKixx update.

Kwik-Hang Curtain Rod Brackets.recapBody:
**Shar Tank Kwik-Hang Update **

Despite not landing a deal on Shark Tank, our Kwik-Hang update research found that the company has become a million-dollar business.

After Derrek’s appearance on Shark Tank, Kwik-Hang brackets received a lot of attention because of the story behind it.

In 2017, Derrek expanded product sizes and, in 2018, secured distribution deals in over 5,000 ACE Hardware stores. Major retailers like Home Depot, Walmart, and Amazon soon followed.

Despite patents protecting the design, Kwik-Hang has faced challenges with cheap knock-offs. Derrek's fight for their removal continues on platforms like Amazon.

In April 2020, Derrek won the U.S. Patriot Award for having a veteran-run business that also employs vets. All products are American-made and use inputs that are also made in the USA.

In February 2021, Derrek's entrepreneurial journey took another exciting turn with an appearance on HGTV's Self-Made Mansions. As of August 2023, Kwik-Hang boasts over $9 million in lifetime sales and a thriving business generating roughly $1 million annually.

You can buy products on the Kwik-Hang website, Amazon, or your local hardware store.

With millions in sales, things are looking promising for our next Kwik-Hang update.

Tutublue.recapBody:
Shark Tank TuTuBlue Update

Even without an endorsement from a shark, TuTuBlue is doing well. In 2022, the Amazon store was is filled with positive reviews and great designs. Research for our TuTuBlue update revealed that the company has outlets in Las Vegas, Santa Monica, and Miami Beach.

Annual revenue is reported to be nearly $11 million and they even offer men’s suits now! You can shop on their Amazon store or at the TuTuBlue website.

Mella Pet Care Products.recapBody:
Shark Tank Mella Pet Care Update

In our Mella Pet Care update, we found that the company seems to be doing well after Shark Tank. They're set to launch some new products, which will bring more customers into the fold.

They have plans to launch a pet bowl scale, a chip reader, and a pulse oximeter. You can learn more, and even shop for gadgets on the Mella Pet Care website.

Once the dust settles, we will circle back for another Mella Pet Care update to see what's been going on since Shark Tank.

Black Sands Entertainment.recapBody:
Shark Tank Black Sands Entertainment Update

During our Black Sands Entertainment update, we found that they have been featured at New York Comic Con, Publishers Weekly, and other high-quality authorities on comic media.

According to U.S. News, Black Sands Entertainment was able to finalize the deal with Hartbeat. With the deal sealed, they're moving forward with developing an animated feature based on the "Black Sands" series.

One of the company's first big moves is an anime production deal with Composition Media to adapt its comics into a series.

Even better, after appearing on the show, Black Sands Entertainment sold more than 200,000 copies of their comic books. Additionally, the company has surpassed $2 million in lifetime sales.

Manuel also shares with the same publication that landing the deal with Kevin Hart and Mark Cuban has been a game-changer. Because of this, the company now has the connections to land top-quality voice and animation talent.

The company is increasing its focus on awareness, as well. They created an app to showcase Black talent, and are working to get their books into schools across the country.

They sell bundles of their various titles on the Black Sands Entertainment website, where you can also find some sweet merch.

We can't wait to see where our next Black Sands Entertainment update takes us!

Snarky Tea.recapBody:
Shark Tank Snarky Tea Update

According to our research, the deal with Kevin O'Leary and guest shark Bethenny Frankel eventually closed. However, the originally agreed term of $150,000 for a 50% equity was revised to $150,000 for a 12% equity.

Since the show aired, Snarky Tea has continued to thrive. The brand hasn't strayed from its signature "snarky" voice, even adding playful mugs with cheeky messages.

They've also expanded their offerings with a monthly subscription service and seasonal tea blends.

Our Snarky Tea update found that in 2020, the company acquired BRUW, a fellow Shark Tank company. This acquisition allowed them to develop a cold tea maker, further diversifying their product line.

Interestingly, Snarky Tea also introduced a new line of "Feel Good" teas with names like "Cleanse" and "Detox." These teas offered similar benefits to their existing blends but with a more neutral tone.

Since airing, the company has grown its annual sales to over $6 million, so we can call this Snarky Tea update a success!

Foot Cardigan Sock Subscription.recapBody:
Shark Tank Foot Cardigan Update

It’s all good news for Foot Cardigan! While the deal with Mark and Troy never closed, the company is still doing fine. Bryan stayed on for a while as CEO, before leaving in 2018 for another company.

Our Foot Cardigan update research revealed that the company was purchased by a significant Dallas-based holding company and currently pulls in about $4 million annually. You can get your subscription on the Foot Cardigan website.

Mama’s Milkbox.recapBody:
Shark Tank Mama's Milk Box Update

Our Mama's Milk Box update found that the company stayed afloat for nearly two years, even without the sharks' backing.

However, by November 2017, the business couldn't keep up, and the subscription service had shut down.

Though Elena had initially planned to sell her designs directly to consumers, by November 2018, Mama's Milk Box was fully closed.

At the time of writing our Mama's Milk Box update, Elena is a Chief Marketing Officer in Pittsburgh and is launching a new bracelet startup called Bucky and Bling.

Unfortunately, this is our final Mama’s Milk Box update.

Pluto Pillow Personalized Pillows.recapBody:
Pluto Pillow Update | S12

Despite walking away from Shark Tank without a deal, we do have some good news in our Pluto Pillow update. The company has grown quite a bit since the show and we were able to catch up with Susana to talk about what's happened since Shark Tank.

"We've been super fortunate as the product seemed to have resonated well with a national audience," Susana told us. She continued, "After the first night, we were backordered by 6 weeks and sold over 2,000 pillows within a few hours."

Fortunately, Susana shared that this growth continued in the following months and as they released new products. "We're on track to hit eight figures in 2023," Susana shared.

Further, Susana also shared that "each of our products has won a number of awards" with the pillow itself winning over ten!

With all the success, Pluto Pillow shows no signs of slowing down and Susana even teased some big plans for 2024. So we will have to follow up with her again down the line for another Pluto Pillow update!

If you'd like to get a pillow, head over to the Pluto Pillow website. Susana was kind enough to send me a pillow, and you can read my review of it below!

Pluto Pillow Review

Susana and Kevin were kind enough to send my wife and me our own Pulto Pillows to test out. After sleeping on it for a few weeks, I've got to say, it's pretty amazing and is now my favorite pillow I've used!

The process of creating my pillow was incredibly simple. All that I had to do was visit the website and answer a few questions about my current pillow and sleeping habits. That's it!

Outside of the pillow, one thing that stood out to me was the packaging and presentation. The Pluto Pillow came in a custom-designed box and was wrapped beautifully. It had a note inside with my name handwritten on it and even included a piece of candy!

I've been sleeping on the pillow for about three weeks now and I can definitely tell a difference in how I sleep. I recently went on vacation and left my Pluto Pillow at home and after the first night of vacation, I wished that I brought it with me!

I would highly recommend trying out Pluto Pillow. They have a 125-day money-back guarantee too, so it's risk-free! Enjoy better sleep and order your Pluto Pillow!

Balm Chicky Balm Balm.recapBody:
Shark Tank Balm Chicky Balm Balm Update

Our Balm Chicky Balm Balm update may not be super surprising to anyone who saw the company receive negative feedback on Shark Tank. Unfortunately the company is no longer around and it seems like they ultimately ran out of money in the years after appearing on Shark Tank. This will be our final Balm Chicky Balm Balm update.

Shell Bobbers.recapBody:
Shark Tank Shell Bobbers Update

In an update provided on Season 5 of Shark Tank, fans find out that Shell Bobbers is selling well. They were poised to be sold in more than 3,000 7-Eleven locations nationwide, while a separate deal with WalMart was in negotiations and eventually closed. Despite this, the company is out of business as of 2023. This will be our final Shell Bobbers update.

Granola Gourmet Energy Bars.recapBody:
Shark Tank Granola Gourmet Update

Our research on Granola Gourmet update found that Jeff secured investments from other investors and expanded into over 600 stores, including Safeway, Vons, Whole Foods, and Amazon, by 2011.

This growth led to a follow-up feature on Shark Tank, where he further shared his success and revealed more details about his expansion into Amazon.

However, the company faced challenges. By 2013, Granola Gourmet's social media went silent, and the website became inactive in 2016.

While Jeff's LinkedIn profile indicates the business is still active, the product has vanished from both physical and online stores, suggesting a quiet closure.

According to our Granola Gourmet update research, intensified competition and market oversaturation likely contributed to declining sales and the company's eventual disappearance from the public eye.

However, as of this writing, Jeff has since shifted focus to other ventures, leaving Granola Gourmet's future uncertain.

This will likely be our final Granola Gourmet update.

Ilumi.recapBody:
Shark Tank iLumi Update

Now let’s get to that iLumi update. The company has been successful in the many years since appearing on Shark Tank. Bluetooth technology continues to evolve, and the company found other IoT applications for Bluetooth connectivity, which they license to manufacturers. In 2019, the company changed its name to MeshTek, and have an estimated revenue of $6 million. Products are available on the MeshTek website and on Amazon.

Little Nomad Play Mats.recapBody:
Shark Tank Little Nomad Update

Our Little Nomad update found that Shark Tank's exposure spiked demand, and the company sold out all of its inventory shortly after airing.

In June 2019, Elizabeth raised $267,622 on Kickstarter to launch the NamaMat.

By October 2019, she rebranded the company to The House of NOA.

In 2020, Elizabeth expanded her product line to include a portable high chair mat, an exercise mat, and table placemats.

That same year, the company received backing from Summit Partners.

Further, by 2021, washable rugs were introduced, keeping up with the demand for attractive yet functional home items.

Our Little Nomad update found that The House of NOA is thriving and has grown to around $5 million in annual revenue.

We're calling this Little Nomad update a success.

Gnome Advent Calendar.recapBody:
Shark Tank Gnome Advent Calendar Update

Our Gnome Advent Calendar update found that shortly after its episode was filmed, Jenna shipped 900 Christmas Countdown Calendars.

Further, she has already announced a Halloween Gnome Countdown Calendar that will be available for pre-order in June 2025, followed by the Christmas Gnome Advent Calendar in August.

All products can be ordered through the Gnome Advent Calendar website.

Despite its success, our Gnome Advent Calendar update found that Jenna has tons of knockoffs by other companies.

To combat this, Jenna is actively working to build her brand and dominate the gnome calendar market.

Once the dust settles, we will be back with another Gnome Advent Calendar update!

Sorsoap Massage Bar Soap.recapBody:
Shark Tank SORx Update

In terms of a SOPx update, the company received a nice boost in sales after airing on Shark Tank. Plus, with Mark's help, Dr. Dan and David are sure to get their products into the hands of millions of folks with achy, sore muscles.

If you're interested in trying muscle scraping, either in or out of the shower, check out the SORx website. You can make a purchase there and learn more about what this company is up to!

Once the dust settles, we will circle back for another SORx update.

LoveSync Button.recapBody:
Shark Tank LoveSync Update

As far as a LoveSync update goes, the company is still in business. Further, the physical buttons must be doing well, because their lifetime revenue is reported to be $1.2 million.

Additionally, it was featured on a lot of different talk shows and publications, but not all of the press is positive. Some hosts said it was the worst idea they’d heard, and the product itself prompted a lot of online negativity.

However, our LoveSync update research found that since Shark Tank they have worked on their app and have launched it in the app store. Their app launch was mildly successful, with at least 1,000 downloads in the Google Play store.

You can check out their products on the LoveSync website.

If we get any more news on a LoveSynce update, we will let you know!

Pop It Pal Pimple Popping Toy.recapBody:
Shark Tank Pop It Pal Update

Let’s get a Pop It Pal update and see how the company is performing after Shark Tank.  The deal eventually closed with Kevin O’Leary and the company still exists and operates.

If this is a product that appeals to you, check it out on the Pop It Pal website, or on Amazon.

They are currently bringing in an annual revenue of $1 million, with a net worth of $10 million. Further, Pop It Pal gives a portion of every sale to charities that support kindness and anti-bullying.

Pretty Padded Room.recapBody:
Shark Tank Pretty Padded Room Update

In 2014, Bea rebranded, naming her company Your Corner. The changes and the business were short-lived however, as she shut down in 2016. The next year, Bea would give it another go, now naming her operation The Difference. As of December 2023, The Difference has yet to launch, but you can follow Bea Arthur on her website. This will be our final Pretty Padded Room update.

Tristen Ikaika Fork and Spoon Jewelry.recapBody:
Shark Tank Tristen Ikaika Update

Unsurprisingly, it looks like the Tristen Ikaika brand is still thriving. He appears to be transitioning the brand identity, referring to the company currently as Ikaika Studios on its website and social media channels.

Since Shark Tank, Tristen has introduced a signature collection with a huge variety of rings in addition to his monthly drops. A limited branded clothing line is also available, but the majority of products are rings on the Tristen Ikaika website.

Tristen is also still leaning into his influencer status. If you'd like to keep up with him, you can also find him on Instagram where he has more than 11,000 followers, or TikTok, where he's got more than 84,000 loyal followers of the brand.

As far as the deal goes, there's no mention of Shark Tank anywhere on the Ikaika website, and it seems like the deal with Kevin was never finalized.

Regardless, we're sure our next Tristen Ikaika update will show continued success for the jewelry influencer and his brand.

Aquapaw Pet Bathing Tool.recapBody:
Shark Tank Aquapaw Update

While the duo respectively rejected Daymond’s final offer, they seem to be doing quite alright without a deal after all. From a business perspective, many people might agree that Daniel and Tom made the right decision.

Further, in addition to the original sprayer, they now have one for bathing horses. They also sell feeding mats, and licking pads for dogs.

The Baby Toon Soft Baby Spoon.recapBody:
Shark Tank The Baby Toon Update

We have great news to share in The Baby Toon update! The company is still in business, earning an estimated $1 million a year. Further, since appearing on Shark Tank, the company has entered into a licensing deal with the baby brand Munchkin.

The Baby Toon is currently sold through Munchkin, Amazon, and other retail stores.

There are currently three colors of the spoon, Blue Koala, Lime Alligator, and Mint Elephant, which are all sold for around $6.

Cassidy’s company has a lot of potential for expansion in the baby product niche. That said, this entrepreneur is still a kid.

We imagine that the deal with Lori and getting the licensing deal with Munchkin have helped Cassidy accomplish the goals she shared on the show, enjoying her childhood and focusing on school.

However, if there is any more news on a The Baby Toon update, we will be sure to let you know!

Angel Shave Club For Women.recapBody:
Shark Tank Angel Shave Club Update

Unfortunately, we have very sad news to share in our Angel Shave Club update. The company sadly began to run out of money in 2019.

Then, when the COVID-19 pandemic hit, they were unable to sustain business, according to a letter on the Angel Shave Club website.

As it turns out, the sharks usually have pretty stellar instincts, and it seems that their clairvoyance was correct about Angel Shave Club. Therefore, this will ultiatmely be our final Angel Shave Club update.

Snactiv Finger Chopsticks.recapBody:
Shark Tank Snactiv Update

Since appearing on Shark Tank, Snactiv seems to be doing well. According to their Kickstarter updates, the initial orders were shipped in October 2021 to a bunch of happy backers.

Currently, there are more than 1,000 positive reviews on Amazon with over 2,000 units being sold each month. The product can also be purchased directly from the Snactiv website and other online retailers.

In addition to the original Snactiv Pro in single or multipacks, they're also selling a lighter version, the Snactiv Light. Additionally, the company is selling humorous branded t-shirts that give the appearance of a cheese dust spill.

While our Snactiv update didn't turn up any new revenue numbers, the pair are working hard to grow the company. They're actively promoting on social media with a target audience of gamers and exploring additional sales avenues.

It's unclear whether they closed the deal with Kevin and Lori, but Snactiv is eating up its share of the market regardless of shark support. At this rate, our next Snactiv update is sure to be a good one!

Dura-Tent Table Top Food Screen.recapBody:
Shark Tank Dura-Tent Update

We have great news to share in our Dura-Tent update! Dan eventually re-branded with a new name called PicnicPal. Products can be purchased on the company website and on Amazon. In 2023, the company is valued around $1 million.

Salespreneur Sales Training.recapBody:
Shark Tank Salespreneur Update

Our Salespreneur update reveals that the company did not manage to triumph after the Shark Tank appearance. The business seems to have closed down in 2012, and Dave moved on to other ventures.

Because of this, this will be our final Salespreneur update.

XTorch Solar Flashlight and Charger.recapBody:
Shark Tank XTorch Update

XTorch currently holds an average of a 4.5-star rating out of 200+ ratings on Amazon and seems to be a hit with customers.

While it doesn't seem that Gene and Keidy have been able to build the company into a multi-million business, it seems they're still growing and increasing sales!

College Foxes Packing Boxes.recapBody:
Shark Tank College Foxes Packing Boxes Update

Our College Foxes Packing Boxes update research found that the business closed shortly after its episode airing due to its impractical and somewhat sexist business model.

However, its parent company, College Hunks Hauling Junk, continued to thrive and has grown to over 150 locations and $200 million in annual revenue.

Our College Foxes Packing Boxes update found that the company expanded its entrepreneurial efforts in 2011 by launching Trash Butler.

This valet trash service now serves over 150,000 multi-family communities across the U.S.

In 2023, the company received accolades, including spots on Entrepreneur's Top Franchise for Veterans list, Forbes' Best Junk Removal Companies list, and the Inc. 5000 list in Logistics & Transportation.

Nick and Omar also ventured into the entertainment industry, working on the 2023 biopic "Bezos," with Omar as an executive producer and Nick portraying Amazon's first employee, Shel Kaphan.

Though College Foxes Packing Boxes itself wasn't successful, the Shark Tank exposure boosted College Hunks Hauling Junk and established Nick and Omar as recognized industry figures.

Unfortunately, this will be our last College Foxes Packing Boxes update.

Toygaroo.recapBody:
Shark Tank ToyGaroo Update

Our ToyGaroo update shows that the company, unfortunately, folded within a year of Nikki’s appearance on the show. While they did benefit from an uptick in sales immediately following the show, they ultimately could not handle the demand.

Further, it seems that the owners of ToyGaroo and the sharks, could not agree on business decisions such as shipping costs for instance. Overall, the idea was a good one, but it seems the business plan just couldn't be fully carried out.

This will be our final ToyGaroo update.

MAXPRO Fitness.recapBody:
Shark Tank MaxPro Fitness Update

Even before MaxPro Fitness appeared on Shark Tank, Nezar Akeel was doing well. The product is, of course, endorsed by Shaq. It's also been featured in multiple publications, including Business Insider and Men's Health.

Our MaxPro Fitness update shows that the company reached $25 million in sales since inception, and now boasts over 25,000 users.

The company is actively promoting on social media and has a solid showing of more than 35,000 Instagram followers. Even better, they were named Sports Illustrated's "Best Portable Gym" in 2023.

The fitness system is available directly through the MaxPro website and there are hundreds of positive reviews.

So, it looks like MaxPro is building a successful business. We can't wait to see what the next MaxPro update brings!

YouthForia Makeup.recapBody:
Shark Tank Youthforia Update

Our Youthforia update found that the agreement with Mark Cuban was successfully finalized, providing the company with both capital and strategic support.

Following the show's airing, Youthforia experienced significant growth. Daily sales increased from $6,500 to $15,000, and the team expanded from 2 to 10 employees.

At the time of writing, the company reported lifetime sales exceeding $15 million.

The brand's innovative, plant-based makeup products, particularly the BYO Blush, gained substantial media attention.

Features in publications such as Forbes and Allure enhanced its visibility.

Additionally, viral TikTok videos contributed to a 200% sales boost in 2023.

Youthforia expanded its retail presence significantly. Initially launching in 53 Ulta Beauty stores in 2022, the brand expanded to over 500 Ulta locations by 2024.

The products are also available through online platforms like Amazon and the company's website.

As of today, Youthforia's net worth is estimated at approximately $5 million, with annual sales reaching $2 million.

When we get more news on our Youthforia update, we will let you know.

Kudo Banz Rewards For Kids.recapBody:
Shark Tank Kudo Banz Update

The company has experienced some growth since its appearance on Shark Tank and Kudo Banz can still be found online. Gross revenue rests at just under $1 million annually as of last year.  Shark Tank definitely helped Kudo Banz with organic marketing and exposure, but it wasn’t enough of a boost to take them to the next level.

Elliptical Stroller.recapBody:
Shark Tank Elliptical Stroller Update

In April 2018, just a few months after their episode aired, Pier made a Facebook post saying he was going to Europe to meet with a manufacturer.

Our Elliptical Stroller update found that, as of August 2024, that post remains the company's last social media update.

He also announced improvements to the design, including a new, lighter model called The Baby Step, which can be attached to most popular strollers.

During our Elliptical Stroller update research, we found that while the website remains active and functional. However, products have been unavailable for a long time.

At this point, it’s unclear if the business is still operational.

Pier seems to be caught between being an entrepreneur and a real estate agent in Florida.

It looks like this might be our final Elliptical Stroller update.

Shower Toga Portable Public Shower.recapBody:
Shark Tank Shower Toga Update

It turns out that it is still in business and can easily be found online on its website. Revenue has continued to slowly grow since coming out of the COVID-19 pandemic and it seems that Kressa has her company headed in the right direction.

Bottle Bright Cleans Water Bottles.recapBody:
Shark Tank Bottle Bright Update

Our Bottle Bright update reveals some mixed news. The company made its way into stores like Bed Bath and Beyond, but a 2016 deal saw the brand get sold to another firm. The company’s official website is still online but it’s unclear if Seth and Justin are still a part of the company after the acquisition. Products can be purchased on the Bottle Bright website and on Amazon.

Cat Amazing Interactive Toys and Feeders.recapBody:
Shark Tank Cat Amazing Update

After appearing on Shark Tank, Cat Amazing is doing great! In addition to the products they showcased on the show, our Cat Amazing update research revealed a new type of toy, the Snatch Wand, available on the Cat Amazing website.

In addition, Cat Amazing has received lots of positive press, including features in Wired, HousePanther, and The Conscious Cat.

Today, the unique cat puzzles are sold to feline lovers all over the country through retailers like Chewy, Walmart, and Amazon.

Andrey is also making good on his goal of helping shelter cats. The Cat Amazing website features an Enrichment Program where organizations can apply for free puzzle toys for their rescued animals and adoptive families.

With so many cat lovers in the world, we think our next Cat Amazing update will show this company is really going places!

Atlantic Candy Company.recapBody:
Shark Tank Atlantic Candy Company Update

Our Atlantic Candy Company update found that after their Shark Tank appearance, the company encountered some tough challenges.

This included a $2 million lawsuit from an Australian candy company.

Although the lawsuit dragged on until December 2017, it didn't hold them back. They bounced back by redesigning their main product, ToyBox.

At the time of writing, ToyBox is available at major retailers such as Walmart, Target, and Dollar General and has grown to around $4 million in annual revenue.

Additionally, our Atlantic Candy Company update found that they have partnered with well-known brands like Disney, Nestle, and Hershey's through their contract manufacturing services.

It looks like Jared is back on the right track. If we get another Atlantic Candy Company update, we will let you know.

Rumi Spice Saffron.recapBody:
Shark Tank Rumi Spice Update

Our Rumi Spice update found that the deal with Mark Cuban did not close. We know this firsthand because we did not find the company in Mark’s investment portfolio.

However, despite this, Rumi Spice has been featured in various publications, including Forbes.

Most notably, Rumi Spice products are now available in Whole Foods Market stores across the United States.

In 2018, the founders appointed Patti Doyle as CEO to manage the company's operations.

This strategic move allowed the entrepreneurs to focus on other critical business areas, including product development and market expansion.

Later that year, in December 2018, Rumi Spice secured a $2.5 million Series A investment from InFrontier, a prominent venture capital firm.

This funding played a crucial role in expanding their product line and scaling their operations to meet growing demand.

While the company has not disclosed specific sales figures, estimates suggest that Rumi Spice generates approximately $5 million in annual revenue.

If we get another Rumi Spice update, we will let you know.

Wired Waffles.recapBody:
Shark Tank Wired Waffles Update

At first, things looked up for Roger. When the episode aired, everyone wanted to taste the waffle firsthand. Luckily, Roger took the shark’s advice, adjusting the recipe to make it tastier.

In our Wired Waffles update, we found that the exposure brought a deal with a private investor. But in 2015, the company went out of business for unknown reasons.

This will be our final Wired Waffles update.

Earth Log.recapBody:
Shark Tank Earth-Log Update

Our Earth-Log update may be a little bit disappointing because the deal with Lori Greiner never was finalized after the episode aired on Shark Tank. After building some valuable partnerships as a brand, with a variety of retailers, Earth-Log went out of business before the start of 2019. This will be our final Earth-Log update.

Gift Card Rescue.recapBody:
Shark Tank Gift Card Rescue Update

Our research on the Gift Card Rescue update revealed that Kwame eventually turned down the deal with Kevin O'Leary and Robert Herjavec because giving up 50% equity was too much for him.

Since appearing on Shark Tank, Gift Card Rescue initially soared in popularity. Leveraging the show's publicity, they secured a partnership with Amazon.

In 2012, the company had grown to $6 million in annual revenue, and by 2013, it had surpassed $10 million, making Gift Card Rescue one of the fastest-growing startups on Shark Tank.

However, their rapid growth led to financial strain and numerous customer complaints.

Our Gift Card Rescue update found that by 2015, their annual sales revenue had reached $15 million, but in July 2016, a lender's loan default judgment froze the company's bank account, forcing it to shut down.

Kwame attempted to raise funds and renegotiate loan terms but was unsuccessful. The company could not sustain its rapid expansion without adequate financing.

Subsequently, the Better Business Bureau received 300 complaints, primarily from unpaid sellers.

At the time of writing, the Gift Card Rescue website is still active but under new ownership.

Today, Kwame is the CEO and founder of Pioneer Branding, which focuses on helping entrepreneurs build magnetic personal brands.

This will be our final Gift Card Rescue update.

Bunny Eyez Reading Glasses.recapBody:
Shark Tank Bunny Eyez Update

Our Bunny Eyez update reveals that the company is doing well! The exposure from the show got the product in front of millions of viewers and led to tons of sales.

We also found that the company has a huge following on social media, and they have also gained endorsements from celebrities like Soda Kotb, Kaley Cuoco, and more, along with other rave reviews.

The glasses are still available on Amazon and the Bunny Eyez website. It looks like they are continuing to work hard and expand their line of eyewear.

Once the dust settles, we will circle back for another Bunny Eyez update!

Jolly Roger Phone Bots Frustrate Telemar.recapBody:
Shark Tank Jolly Rogers Telephone Update

The company’s growth hasn’t really taken shape since its appearance on Shark Tank in Season 10. Its website is still online and is occasionally updated but there doesn’t seem to be any major sign that anything has changed since the company's appearance on Shark Tank. It seems like its growth is relatively stagnant and there’s no clear indication of whether that will change anytime soon.

Face Yoga Anti-aging Facial Exercises.recapBody:
Shark Tank Face Yoga with Koko Update

We have good news to share in our Face Yoga with Koko update! The company is still in business and has gone on to appear on multiple shows like Keeping Up With The Kardashians, Steve Harvey, and America's Got Talent.

Koko also continues to work with many famous clients, like Kim Kardashian.

Koko’s website now features some skincare items and products to assist you with your face yoga exercises, such as medical tape, skin-balancing sugar oil, and a book of Japanese anti-aging secrets.

On her website, you can also locate other Face Yoga instructors from around the world, who we assume are trained and certified by Koko. She actually sells a certification program for a little over $3,000.

Despite not securing a deal with a shark, Face Yoga with Koko seems to be doing well as a business!

If we hear any more updates, we will make sure to be back with another Face Yoga with Koko update.

Kobee's Lip Balm.recapBody:
Shark Tank Kobee's Update

Our Kobee's update found that shortly after its Shark Tank appearance, his business saw a surge in sales.

At the time of writing, Kobee's continues to sell its products online through its website and Amazon.

Our research into Kobee's update found that shortly after filming their episode, they launched an SPF 15 Lip Balm, priced at $9.

This product not only keeps lips hydrated but also provides UV protection.

However, beyond lip care, Kobee's branched out into skin-nourishing items like the $18 Cuticle Butter, $12 Hand Salve, $24 Overnight Lip Mask, $12 Lip Scrub, and $10 Lotion Bar.

Interestingly, we also found that the brand gives back by donating a portion of its profits to environmental organizations.

These include One Tree Planted, The Alliance for the Great Lakes, and Our Children's Earth Foundation.

We can't wait to see what Kobe is up to in our next Kobee's update.

The Paleo Diet Bar.recapBody:
Shark Tank The Paleo Diet Foods Update

We have great news to share in The Paleo Diet Foods update. The company is still in business, but apparently rebranded under the new name, Paleo Ranch. With an estimated annual revenue of about $3.5 million, they seem to have found a way to success without the help of a shark. Besides Amazon, products are also available on the Paleo Ranch website.

His and Her Bar.recapBody:
Shark Tank His and Her Bars Update

We have unfortunate news to report in our His and Her Bars update. Despite receiving an initial boost in sales after airing on Shark Tank, His and Hers Bars are now out of business.

During our research, we could not locate a website, or any other sign of life. Additionally, products do not appear to be available anywhere.

Further, in February 2022 Michael and Jennifer posted on Instagram that they were "grateful for going on Shark Tank last year and have decided to move in another direction with our business ventures."

This will be our final His and Hers Bars update.

Squatty Potty Toilet Stool.recapBody:
Shark Tank Squatty Potty Update

As you may already know, Squatty Potty would go on to be one of the most successful products to ever be featured on Shark Tank. Research for our Squatty Potty update revealed that Lori managed to help grow the business massively. A company called Aterian, acquired the company in 2021 for more than $30 million. You can get your very own Squatty Potty on the Squatty Potty website and also on Amazon.

Spy Escape and Evasion Courses.recapBody:
Shark Tank Spy Escape and Evasion Update

We have good news to report in our Spy Escape and Evasion update. The company is still in business in 2023, and Jason has gone on to develop his ranch, host many trainings there and he even writes books! You can check out all he offers on the Spy Escape and Evasion website, including a wide range self defense products. His books are also available on Amazon.

Onesole.recapBody:
Shark Tank One Sole Update

Research for our One Sole update revealed that the company is still in business. Dominique continues to enjoy significant success after the Shark Tank appearance.

Diane Sawyer, named One Sole as the Best Product Made in America on ABC World News Tonight. Additionally, the shoes are available in over 80 countries now.

With over 3000 ways to style the One Sole shoes, there is no shortage of options for women to choose from. The products can be found on the One Sole website.

The company now enjoys around $6 million in annual revenue. If we learn anything new about One Sole, we'll be sure to let you know.

Honeyfund Honeymoon Fundraising Platform.recapBody:
Shark Tank Honeyfund Update

Great news for this entrepreneurial couple! Research for our Honeyfund update revealed that Kevin has been an excellent partner.

Honeyfund has continued to grow and dominate the wedding crowdfunding industry, making it easier than ever for customers to raise money for their honeymoons.

While we didn't find any new financial numbers in our Honeyfund update, we did find that Sara and Josh have added the ability for customers to set up funds for other major life events like buying a home or having a baby.

At the time of writing, the company has helped couples raise over $750 million, according to the Honeyfund website.

Chirp Back Roller Wheel.recapBody:
Shark Tank Chirp Update

Research for our Chirp update revealed great news! The company is still in business and is doing better than ever with $5 million in annual revenue.

The Chirp update research found that they have over 1 million happy customers and counting! If you are wondering whether Chirp would help you, that assurance may help you give it a shot!

Our Chirp update also found that since the episode aired, the company has also expanded its product line. They now carry several sizes of wheels, muscle rollers, posture correctors, Chirp accessories, and more!

If you'd like to give the products a try, here's a special offer for Shark Tank viewers. You can also check them out on the Chirp website, and on Amazon.

The World Record Striper Company.recapBody:
Shark Tank World Record Striper Company Update

We have some interesting news to share in our World Record Striper Company update. The company website appears to be down, however the Facebook page was active as recently as November 2022. Products are available on Amazon and other various retailers.

Sway Motorsports.recapBody:
Shark Tank Sway Motorsports Update

We have sad news to share in our Sway Motorsports update. It looks like Mark Cuban never inked the deal with Joe and the company appears to have gone out of business. At some point between 2017 and 2019, Sway Motorsports and their website stopped providing additional updates. This will be our final Sway Motorsports update.

NerdiT Now Phone and Computer Repair.recapBody:
Shark Tank NerdiT Now Update

Research for our NerdiT Now update revealed good news. In 2023, annual revenue has grown to an estimated $4.8 million and they've expanded their model to include contactless mail-in repairs.

We also discovered that the company founded The NERDiT Foundation, which helps to donate computers and train install technicians in countries and communities in need. According to the NerdiT Now website, they’ve donated over 7,000 computers to three countries and helped train 85 technicians.

You can actually donate old tech to them at their locations, and they will refurbish them and gift them to those in need.

Further, the website states that in addition to mobile devices and tablets, they also repair computers and game systems.

If you need repairs done, you simply follow the prompts on their website, and then answer some questions, fill out some information, and choose which method of service you would like.

Despite not getting a deal on Shark Tank, NerdiT Now seems to be doing just fine on its own. If we hear anything more about this company, we'll be sure to let you know!

Influencers in the Wild Board Game.recapBody:
Shark Tank Influencers in the Wild Update

Research for our Influencers in the Wild update reveals that Tank is still selling the game. His own account has over 5 million Instagram followers, which should help him land a lot of sales. Further, with the popularity of Shark Tank, there should be a nice boost in revenue.

If you'd like to try the game out at your next gathering, it can be purchased online through Amazon or the Influencers in the Wild website.

Chill Systems Beverage Cooler.recapBody:
Shark Tank Chill Systems Update

Unfortunately, we have some bad news to share in our Chill Systems update. The sharks may have called this one, as the Chill System just couldn't hang on and is officially out of business.

During our Chill Systems research, we discovered that the company's last social media post was in 2021, and its website is nowhere to be found.

Further digging revealed that the company terminated business sometime between 2021 and 2022.

Hopefully, Chase and Brian and both moved on to something they are equally passionate about.

TOOR.recapBody:
Shark Tank Toor Lockbox Update

Our Toor Lockbox update found that the deal with Barabara Cocoran and Kevin O’Leary did not close.

In 2018, Junior fulfilled his Kickstarter pre-orders, shipping out 800 units, and even partnered with Touch of Modern.

However, our Toor Lockbox update found that the company struggled to maintain momentum.

By the end of 2018, its social media and app updates had stopped, and the product was no longer available for purchase on the website.

By 2020, Junior had shifted gears and co-founded City Naturals, a premium CBD oil business with his wife.

They opened a physical store in Dallas, Texas, which they continue to operate.

At the time of writing, Junior still lists Toor as an active business on his LinkedIn profile, but there have been no significant updates on the product since March 2023, and its revival seems unlikely.

It appears the company has gone out of business, and this will be our final Toor Lockbox update.

Stakt Folding Exercise Mat.recapBody:
Shark Tank Stakt Update

Our Stakt update found that the deal with Loris Griener did not eventually close.

Despite this, the company’s products were available on its official website, Equinox's fitness site, and Amazon.

The company expanded its offerings with a carrying case, branded mat cleaner, and grippy socks. Their product was also recognized on TIME's Best Inventions of 2023 list.

In May 2023, Stakt teamed up with The Sculpt Society to launch a co-branded mat called The Sculpt Society X Stakt Mat. It is priced at $86 and comes in Ice Blue.

They also developed an online yoga class library.

Our research into the Stakt update found that they are now available on Faire, an online wholesale marketplace for smaller retail stores to buy products at wholesale prices.

Additionally, Stakt's net worth is estimated at $1.07 million, with annual revenue of around $110,000.

As of now, Taylor is fully dedicated to Stakt, while Millie continues to balance a regular job alongside her work with the company.

We look forward to sharing another exciting Stakt update soon.

Validated App For Free Rides.recapBody:
Shark Tank Validated Update

Our Validated update found that the company expanded its operations beyond Seattle and Portland.

It launched in major U.S. cities, including New York, San Francisco, Las Vegas, Boston, and Chicago.

The app also integrates additional services like Uber, Lyft, and Biketown, enhancing the user experience.

In May 2019, Validated was acquired by Reach Now, a joint mobility venture between BMW and Daimler.

This acquisition aimed to integrate Validated's rewards system into Reach Now's transportation services.

Our research on the Validated update found that by June 2019, just a month after the acquisition.

The company had ceased operations, and the app had been removed from the Apple and Google Play stores.

Following the closure of Validated, the founders have pursued other ventures.

However, the specifics about their subsequent endeavors are not available.

Unfortunately, this will be our final Validated update.

Surf Band Pro Sunscreen Dispenser.recapBody:
Shark Tank Surf Band Pro Update

Our Surf Band Pro update revealed that Greg had expanded his product line to include bezel and silicone bands.
